reviews.sentence: Enjoyed Our Stay. it is in a great location right in the heart of downtown and a few blocks from Pike Place. Great energy at night with plenty of bars restaurants within walking distance. As for the rooms very clean and comfortable. Definitely stay again when we come to Seattle again.

Great stay for business trips. From the moment I checked in to the Motif in Seattle I felt very at ease. The hotel staff is incredibly courteous and check in was a breeze. The hotel itself is very modern and clean and has a cool vibe that does not feel like they are trying too hard. The restaurant lounge Frolic was also very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. I almost did not want to leave.
Awesone. Amazing felt a little under dressed but all in all beautiful establishment.

Comfy bed. Come in the hotel around 1 am. Dead tired. First time In this hotel. Front desk is very welcoming Warm and friendly. Room is nice. 17th floor nice view of the downtown and ocean. Room is very clean. Bed is so comfy. I mostly want a nice bed and pillows. Shower is nice. Could change the carpet though. In the morning having breakfast on the 5th floor. And the dinner is also good. Amazing and Friendly staff at the restaurant. Overall I find this hotel to be very relaxing and nice. did not realize this was former Red Lion Inn.

Quick trip made easy. I absolutely loved Hotel Motif. We took an early morning flight so we were surprised we were able to check in at 10 am and have our room ready. After arriving early it was nice to settle in our room before we did some exploring. And speaking of exploring this hotel is in an excellent location. Close to everything. And since there are five Starbucks on every block coffee was always close. The coffee in the room was also good. Our main reason for the trip was to attend a baseball game. The ballpark is not exactly close but if you take your time you can enjoy a nice walk to Safeco Field. The staff was awesome. Always greeted with a smile. The room was clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. We were able to have a drink at Frolik and enjoy the roof top patio. It was not too crowded and you can enjoy a conversation through the music. It was only one night but I am sure to go back to Seattle and would definitely consider Hotel Motif again. I would definitely recommend it.

BEST EXPERIANCE OF OUR TRIP THE MOTIF HOTEL. The staff was INCREDIBLY helpful and courteous. The room was clean and the bed SO COMFORTABLE. The location of the hotel was optimal we could not have been in a better spot. We could walk anywhere or were within walking distance to quick inexpensive public transportationLeaving it this was a wonderful hotel.
Quick one night stay. Great place comfortable perfect location close to pikes market and all the shopping. Rooftop bar is great.

Travels relaxing end. This was a three day stay at the end of a two week road trip and provided excellent facilities services to unwind and relax. Location was excellent near pike Place Market and the Monorail. Room and hotel in general were clean bed comfortable restaurant was very nice garage was very convenient. I had go back in a heartbeat.

Post 2015 Womens World Cup. 707 to 71015What a wonderful place to wind down an exciting Canada Womens World Cup win. there is a refreshing chilled ice water cooler infused with fresh fruits as you enter and wonderful warm staff to greet you. We were starving and they were more than happy to steer us to delis and dining of all sorts. We enjoyed two of our meals at the in house restaurant Frolic fun happy hour and perfect place to grab a quick breakfast before heading to the airport. No car we Uber everywhere or roamed the city by foot to Dahlias must go Pikes Market Century Link Stadium etc Motif was a welcoming comfortable and perfect place to get around loved it so much we booked October 2015 as well ❗ ️.

Perfect hotel in great location. This hotel is decorated beautifully and provided me with excellent service during my stay. I was in town for a conference and the location could not have been more perfect. Short walk to Pikes Market the convention center Pioneer Square the space needle shopping and the piers. Staff were incredibly responsive and friendly and the price was affordable.

Not to happy with my stay. I would not come back. The staff at the front desk was helpful and corteous The location is great. Our room was made very late like at 3 PM. The bed was not well made the sheets were all wrinkled. It looks like the room was made in a hurry I was supposed to receive 2 packages from Amazon I only got one. According to Amazon the other package was delivered on wenesday. Stolen.

Modern hotel with great staff. When we arrived we were almost shocked by how modern it looks being from a small town especially. And it continued to impress on the inside all the way down to our room. Everything was nicely updated and modern. The staff was incredible going above and beyond any expectations that I had. The security guard even gave us his personal energy drinks when we could not find any in the hotel.

Brilliant Hotel in the heart of Seattle. Excellent Location. The hotel managed to get us an early check in. Large comfortable rooms very comfortable beds. Walking distance to most places. The rooms were expensive.

We stayed here this past weekend after having booked the hotel online via website recommendations. The booking price was about 200 CDN 150 USD aprox. The actual charged price was 31 CDN about 245USD. After deducting the 35 USd expected parking charge it was still significantly more than expected. Heres what the bill showed. Accommodation 16185 State Sales Tax 307 City Parking Tax 40State Local Tax 1392 Occupancy Tax 13 Seattle Tourism Assessment 20 Amenity Fee 1295 State and Local Tax Fee 11 Occupancy Tax Fe 091Might I suggest that some of these fees and the 195 amenityinternet access charge be incorporated into the basic price of booking. So beware travelers that your actual cost is going to be significantly more than the online booking price. The hotel itself was fine ditto for the customer service from the staff you had get 45 stars if it were not for all the hidden charges.

unfortunately I stayed in this hotel on 6th Feb still 8th Feb 1505 my experience was not so great or even good. unfortunately I stayed in this hotel on first week of feb Room 1505 my experience was not so great or even good there was huge hot water outage for 10 hours in this freezing slowing winter this 10 hours include early morning hours generally you need hot water on this time. I called staff twice but they were not able to confirm exact service restoration time. They should change the Hotel name from MOTIF to NOTIPS my bed pillow covers were not even properly arrange and outer chain was remain open for you to zip it so that it will not hurt youse picture. additionally you will find no people for breakfast in morning that tells a lots about food quality too.

Excellent. Very good experience good location very comfortable convenience excellent staff. Very close to principal attractions in Seattle I will do my best recommendation about this hotel. Try with a different concept.

Disapointing stay. We came here for the weekend and stay was bad from the get go. We arrived late around 11. The person that did the check in was rude. The whole process took longer than necessary. Once we got into our room my youngest son did not feel well. He threw up in the bathroom. I called and asked if we can be moved to another room. She was very curt and said that there was no room available. Understandable if it was sold out. She did not offer any alternative solutions. I told her that I understood housekeeping would be gone but requested for them to come and clean first thing in the morning. Morning came and we were in and out of the room. Our room was not cleaned till about 4 pm. And they did not do a good job either. I could still see where my son was puking up. All in all the whole experience was awful.

Pretty good. Came with girlfriends for a staycation. The location is superb close to everything. The con was that the room was quite dark even w all the lights on and the beds were really hard and springy. Also rooms did n’t seem to match the pictures. Still a good deal for what we got.

Excellent Downtown Seattle Hotel. My wife and I spent three nights at the Motif Seattle both before and after a recent Alaskan cruise. We arrived two days prior to sailing which allowed us one full day to see some of the sights. First the hotel the Motif is an upscale hotel located in the busy downtown area of Seattle. The rooms are modern tastefully decorated and roomy. On our first visit May 10 12 we had a room on a lower floor. On the return night May 19 the hotel generously provided an upgrade to a larger room on the 20th floor. We returned to Seattle from the cruise a few hours before the room was ready and the staff graciously tagged and stored our bags while we waited. The hotel has all the expected amenities for a place of this scale. One nice feature is the Frolik Restaurant on the fifth floor which serves scheduled meals and has a lovely bar and an open patio deck for relaxing and looking over the Seattle skyline. there is a basement tavern and restaurant on site called Elephant and Castle as well. You will not find any lack of quality restaurants in the area with many just walking distance away. Speaking of walking there is lots of sites to see nearby including the Space Needle Seattle Center and Pikes Market. Both are a reasonable walk from the hotel. I mentioned that the accommodations are lovely. The beds are roomy and comfortable there are large screen TVs with actual HD programming you had be surprised how many places do not have it spotlessly clean bathrooms and plenty of necessities. When reserving ask if there is a room facing 5th Avenue in the front of the hotel for a more desirable view. My only complaint and it is a minor one has to do with the TV remote controls in both rooms. I do not know if it is an installation programming or battery thing but both were a bit difficult to use. One only worked when we mashed the buttons and the other literally had to be pointed directly at the TV in a certain spot or it would not react. Like a lot of hotels they use generic remotes that are replaceable and universal but you should not need to sit on top of the TV to turn the volume up or change a channel. Luckily each room is equipped with an Amazon Alexa device which can turn the TV on and off as well as provide a lot of other helpful information. If you are going on a cruise at any of the nearby ship terminals this is an ideal place to stay. All the terminals are no more than a few minutes away by cab rideshare. We sailed from the 91st Street terminal which is the furthest away and it was a quick trip by cab. Most of the cabs offer a flat rate between the downtown hotels and the terminals as well as Sea Tac Airport. Regarding cabs you will never have to wait more than a few moments to get a cab or rideshare as the cab stand in front of the hotel is very busy. Getting an Uber Lyft in Seattle is really easy as just about every other car we saw appeared to be one. When we left to fly home we dragged our bags to the sidewalk and a cab appeared in literally no time for a lift to the airport. We highly recommend the Motif Seattle and we hope to return in the future.
Clean and comfortable but I have always had issues with billing I was charged parking without having a car. However they are attentive to resolve any problems.
Will be staying at the Motif again on our next visit to Seattle. So handy to the downtown area.

New years Eve at the Motif Seattle. We really enjoyed our stay at the Motif Seattle on New years Eve. My wife and I had 24 hours away from the children and upon check in Eugene Ford concierge manager was able to upgrade our room to the 20th floor with a beautiful view of the Puget sound Eliot Bay the Great wheel and views of the Bainbridge ferry coming in and out of the terminal. Eugene Ford also had a bottle of wine delivered to our room on ice before we got back from lunch and allowed us an early check in. Thanks Sir. He really went the extra mile to make us feel at home during our stay there. The room itself was very comfortable. I love the modern layout with the couch seating area. The walk in shower in the bathroom along with the mini fridge. I also enjoyed the fact that it had Alexa voice controls for anything in the room including changing the TV channel etc or requesting service room service or contacting front desk requesting maintenance or pretty much anything. since I have lower back problems I always request a firm mattress but in this case did not need to it already was just right and did not wake up with a sore back the next day. Thanks Motif Eugene Ford looking forward to our next romantic getaway at your establishment.
The hotel itself is pretty run down and it desperately needs a renovation. However the location is perfect given that it is downtown.

Not one of the better Hyats in town. I liked the location the proximity to the Elephant and Castle pub and the general look and feel of the place. The decor is modern and almost boutiquey with a definite local flavor. But the hotel seemed to be chronically understaffed. I do n’t think I saw a concierge there in a three night stay. I ended up handing my laundry to a housekeeper and then front desk had trouble finding it and did not deliver it to my room. I had to hunt it down. The room itself was ok. I had a double queen and requested a room far from the elevator. I got 1417 right next to the elevator which I ’ve never experienced before as a top tier World of Hyat customer. Fortunately the room is fairly sound proof. Sound does not travel through the floors the way it does at Hyat House and Hyat Place near the Space Needle. But that does not compensate for a shower that dripped noisily all night or a shower gel pump that would not pump or was maybe even empty or a bathroom door that slid right off its lower hinges trapping me in the bathroom at 2 am until I lifted it off its runners. I think this hotel survives on its Happy Hour which seems to entail free wine and beer for all guests during certain hours of the day. I did n’t check out the bar restaurant or the gym. Maybe these qualities would make it worthwhile for you. For me there are plentiful other Hyat options in Seattle I would chose over this hotel.

My room was very cold other than that everything was just OK. The hotels location is really convenient very near to every nice restaurants cafes shopping malls and stores. there is a lot of transportation around also it is very flat if you do not wana walk up the hill unlike other hotelsOther than that my room was very cold during this winter. I tried to turn the heater on but it was just way too cold for a 78F degrees and it fees like 60F degrees. I did not order in their restaurant because as we know most hotels have ridiculous expensive food but just the same quality as any ordinary food. So I ordered through grubhub ubereats. Overall the room is clean but the lighting is too dark could have been better. The toilet flushes too loud and could hear other rooms flush. The price is affordable at least to what I booked it is 175 night.

Great hotel for business trips. I went to Seattle for a big conference at the convention center. It always felt so nice to return to my room. It was designed really well. The bed was extremely comfortable soft and supportive. There was bright and soft lighting. It was extremely clean and comfortable. I never heard any noise from others rooms. I slept so well in that room. There is a restaurant bar in the hotel and a pub below the hotel. It was very convenient. Gene the concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. He makes his guests feel like VIPs. Would definitely return and recommend. The only recommendation I have is to lessen the lobby fragrance.

Boutique in a business building. This hotel obviously was previously a business building. Few things that are not logisticaly right for a hotel. Comfort 3This place try ’s very hard but seems to miss the mark. Having a in room “ Alexa ” is nice but it is not set up or useable. The rooms are roomy but the design is a little distorted. Lastly parking is a hassle in a separate building and needs a walk through a dingy alley. On top of the walk it is not accessible and a pain to carry luggage to the lobby. Service 3Staf seems to be very green and old without much experience. Location 4In the heart of downtown Seattle more in the northeastern side so a walk to the pier may be a little far. Shopping in walking distance and several restaurants near the area. Will try other locations before I come back.

Motifs location is impeccable walking distance to Pike Place Market and it is literally right in the middle of the business shopping district. Everyone who worked at Motif were absolutely lovely and professional. They even have happy hour in the lobby from 1 8pm what a nice perk. I wanted to deduct one point but ended up not I got upgraded to the 20th top floor. However the walls felt like they were paper thin and we could hear both rooms next to ours loudly. Kids screaming and jumping around loud sex then it turnede into a screaming argument after. and then our last night at 2 AM a group of girls were next door chatting so loud we had to call downstairs. It was not super relaxing but aside from that everything else was great. we had definitely come back when we visit Seattle but I would request for a quieter room the next time.

Conveniently located. We booked this place thru Bokingcom. Rooms were nice and spacious and quiet. Crazy though that parking is not included in the price of the room. With the price of the rooms you would think it would be. All in all a very nice place.

We visited for date night. The hotel staff were excellent and we loved the craft beer taster as we checked in. The room was comfortable and quiet. Only two nicks. the stand up shower did not drain all the water some ended up in puddles on the bathroom floor and Froliks drinks vibe were underwhelming. Many better places to enjoy yourself locally so I am glad we planned on going out on the town. The concierge helped check us out and was a real gem. Thank you Wade.

Do n’t take anything of value with you. Thankfully I never take my jewelry off when traveling. I had a new pot of Clinique eye cream not cheap as seen in photo below from their website stolen in the middle of my stay. The girl from the front desk simply told me that I probably packed it. Why would someone pack in the middle of a stay. I asked for a supervisor and got nowhere. No reply from staff or supervisor and def. no eye cream upon return home and fully unpacked. Do n’t leave your valuables in the room. Disappointed.

One night short story. We booked two nights at the Motif but could only stay one night due to Virgin Atlantic changing our flights. This meant checking in was a little slower than it might usually be even though we had emailed ahead to let the hotel know and received a polite response. We were upgraded to a nice spacious room that helped us acclimatise after a long journey and slept comfortably between the soft bed linen. Expect to pay a separate tax of around 30 a night upon checking out and you need to leave credit card details with the front desk upon checking in. Your passport will not be taken away or photocopied. The payment terminals are perhaps a little old as they did n’t accept Apple Pay. The Motif is in a good location with some hills to climb. Plenty to see and do.

The restaurant atmosphere is more like a pub with lots of televisions and very noisy. Food was good though. I had an unpleasant attempt to extend my stay that was rejected since I had booked through Expedia. I will not stay there again.

Good central location with comfortable room and nice bed. Easy to walk to several town areas. Central location near the game day event. Hotel was more than was necessary very fancy and up to date. Nice place with a coffee store across the street. Hotel was fairly expensive compared to others in the area. The room was very complete and comfortable however slightly expensive.

So dirty. Dirty hand prints on the curtains. Water rings on the counter clearly not cleaned before we got there. The vent above the bed was so full of dust that when air was on it would drop dust onto the bed. The shower would not drain had to get out shut it off and wait before rinsing.

Seattle Motif Hotel. Beautiful hotel. Entrance to lobby was confusing from the parking garage as elevator was under construction. Wonderful staff super helpful concierge. Caveat do not leave your gloves on the bed as they may leave the room with the laundry.

Great customer service. Really enjoyed my stay and recommend. Excellent customer service. All the staff went out of their way for us especially the day crew in the lobby. Special kudos to Redi who bent over backwards for us. I ’m guessing the staff is a reflection on how the hotel treats them good indication. I did not however appreciate the resort fee which pays for nothing I can make out except for some of the worst wine I ’ve ever tasted in the lobby. No breakfast for this 20 fee. Bad style. I am sure it is just an attempt to make people think they ’re getting a lower room rate. I do n’t like to be treated this way. Leaves a bad taste in my mouth so to speak. The room was great spacious well appointed. Even enough hooks so unusual. Only lacking a towel loop for a hand towel why do n’t hotels include this. It ’s seldom provided and it ’s super annoying.

Very Good. super nice staff. central location. There is a real problem with the bathroom door that is literally not closing. a barn door is just not appropriate for a bathroom. I would not stay again for this reasonwals and doors are rather thin so you hear neighbors a lotconstruction work next dorbad smell in the room and not possible to open the window due to the type of building.
The heat in my room wast working. could not get the room to heat up above 68.
